acupuncture_points: ST-36 (Zusanli), REN-12 (Zhongwan), SP-6 (Sanyinjiao), BL-20 (Pishu), REN-6 (Qihai)
pharmacopeia: Primarily cooked with small raw amounts if strong digestion allows

question: How to treat bloating from cruciferous vegetables?
answer: Spleen Qi Deficiency with Qi Stagnation. Cruciferous vegetables cause gas when spleen weak and qi stagnates. Tonify spleen, move qi, cook thoroughly, reduce portions, add digestive spices.
acupuncture_points: ST-36 (Zusanli), REN-12 (Zhongwan), ST-25 (Tianshu), LV-3 (Taichong), PC-6 (Neiguan), SP-6 (Sanyinjiao)
pharmacopeia: Bao He Wan (Preserve Harmony) plus Mu Xiang Shun Qi San, cook thoroughly

question: What TCM treatment addresses constipation despite high fiber intake?

question: How does TCM help patients who eat dried fruits excessively?
